Real Madrid midfielder Toni Kroos want to work with Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp, according to reports in Spain.

Kroos is said to be growing frustrated at Real Madrid and has been hugely disappointed by this season’s failure to defend their La Liga title.

Spanish outlet Don Balon claim the Germany international has a number of offers on the table to leave the Bernabeu.

And the report says he is keen to jump ship and work with his fellow countryman and Liverpool boss Klopp.

Kroos has reportedly been told by his team-mates that Klopp is a fantastic manager to play for and the midfielder’s interest has been piqued.

Source: Daily Express

Jurgen Klopp is still hopeful that Emre Can will sign a new deal. Klopp on Can: “We have to create a situation where players want to stay – that's all we can do as a club, as a team and me as a manager. For me, there is no problem if Emre plays like he is in the moment.”

The Reds turned down a loan request from the Spanish club, insisting that they would only consider an offer for their England striker if it contained an option for a permanent deal at the end of any loan period. (@MirrorFootball)

Liverpool are adamant they want a transfer fee of around £25m for the forward, but are prepared to write in a loan period with a guarantee of a payment in the summer. (@MirrorFootball)

Sources within Anfield though, suggest Sturridge has held talks with Liverpool’s top brass and made clear that he prefers Sevilla’s approach. (@MirrorFootball)
